Genre.description: Genre describes categories of Works, characterized by similar plots, themes, settings, situations, and characters. Examples of genres are “westerns” and “thrillers”. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.4.3 and FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms D.2.1

has_alternate_name.description: Alternative human-readable name(s) for a thing. Whereas has_name provides the preferred display name for the described entity, alternatives can be recorded here in order to be indexed in search engines, for instance

has_name.description: Human-readable name for a thing. This is to be treated as the preferred display label in a UI context, whereas has_alternate_name can provide additional terms, e.g. for matching in search operations

Genre.title: Genre

GeographicName.description: Name of country, region or other location. Names should be taken from appropriate authorities (e.g. GND) and recorded as a human readable string in the name attribute and as linked data in the same_as attribute. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.3.3, D.4

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

GeographicName.title: GeographicName

ISILResource.description: International Standard Identifier for Libraries and Related Organizations including (film) archives. Check id slot range documentation for examples

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

ISILResource.title: ISILResource

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

described_by.description: Also record some metadata about the PID itself rather than the identified object

element_type.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.7.8

has_access_status.description: Status of item determining access conditions. See also FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.7.1

has_alternative_title.description: Additional title(s) associated with the work / variant, manifestation, or item.

has_duration.description: Total running time of the described object in ISO 8601 duration format. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 2.3.5.3, 3.1.5.11

has_event.description: Associate event(s) with a moving image record

has_extent.description: Physical length or size of the described object. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 2.3.5.2, 3.1.5.8

has_identifier.description: Record PID in this slot when exporting data from the PID system. Use local identifiers instead when PIDs have not been registered yet. The latter is suitable for transferring data to the agent responsible for registering PIDs

has_note.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual Appendix B

has_primary_title.description: Primary title to be displayed in search results etc. The type should be PreferredTitle for works / variants and TitleProper for manifestations / items. If not available, type must be SuppliedDevisedTitle, instead.

has_webresource.description: Link to data provider's own presentation of manifestation or item on the web

is_copy_of.description: Link to AVefi item registered by another institution indicating that the two are known to be copies of each other

is_derivative_of.description: Link to AVefi item from which this one has been derived in whole or in part, e.g. as a result of a restoration or digitasation project

is_item_of.description: Indicate AVefi Manifestation the item belongs to. Every item must be associated with a manifestation from the same data provider

ItemAccessStatusEnum.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.7.3
ItemAccessStatusEnum.title: ItemAccessStatusEnum

ItemElementTypeEnum.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.7.8
ItemElementTypeEnum.title: ItemElementTypeEnum

Language.description: Provide language code from ISO 639-2 (Part 2: Alpha-3) and a list of language usage terms from our controlled vocabulary. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.3.5, 2.3.3

code.description: [ISO 639-2 code](https://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-2.html) for the Representation of Names of Languages (Part 2: Alpha-3)

LocalResource.description: Some identifier used by data provider to represent relations between work/variant, manifestation and item when PIDs have not been assigned yet. On ingest into AVefi, these identifiers will be replaced by the generated PIDs

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

LocalResource.title: LocalResource

Manifestation.description: Manifestation as defined in FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 2.0. Note that manifestation type is recorded as publication event type

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

described_by.description: Also record some metadata about the PID itself rather than the identified object

has_alternative_title.description: Additional title(s) associated with the work / variant, manifestation, or item.

has_colour_type.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 2.3.4.4, 3.1.5.6, D.7.11

has_duration.description: Total running time of the described object in ISO 8601 duration format. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 2.3.5.3, 3.1.5.11

has_event.description: Associate event(s) with a moving image record

has_extent.description: Physical length or size of the described object. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 2.3.5.2, 3.1.5.8

has_identifier.description: Record PID in this slot when exporting data from the PID system. Use local identifiers instead when PIDs have not been registered yet. The latter is suitable for transferring data to the agent responsible for registering PIDs

has_item.description: Indicate AVefi Items the institution has registered as part of the manifestation

has_note.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual Appendix B

has_primary_title.description: Primary title to be displayed in search results etc. The type should be PreferredTitle for works / variants and TitleProper for manifestations / items. If not available, type must be SuppliedDevisedTitle, instead.

has_sound_type.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 2.3.4.3, 3.1.5.3, D.7.4

has_webresource.description: Link to data provider's own presentation of manifestation or item on the web

is_manifestation_of.description: Indicate AVefi WorkVariant (possibly more but no less than one) that is subject of the manifestation

same_as.description: Link to AVefi resource registered by another data provider indicating that the two manifestations are known to be the same. Use this, for instance, when you have cooperated in making a digital restoration of some film work

ManufactureEvent.description: Manufacture event of a manifestation. Always specify the type of event and if possible a date or a period of time via has_date. Specify located_in as appropriate, e.g. the country where the labratory is located. Involved parties in various roles can be linked via has_activity. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.4.7

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

has_activity.description: Associate activity (and subsequently agents) with event

has_date.description: Date (or interval/period) when an event has taken place. A subset of ISO 8601 is supported, more specifically, EDTF conformance level 0 as well as qualifiers ? (uncertain date) and ~ (approximate date). See type ISODate definition for details

located_in.description: Location associated with an event, e.g. the country where the principal offices or production facilities of the production company are located should be associated with the production event

type.description: See specific class documentation for controlled vocabulary applicable to the type slot, respectively

ManufactureEvent.title: ManufactureEvent

ManufactureEventTypeEnum.title: ManufactureEventTypeEnum

ProductionEvent.description: Production event of a work/variant (or manifestation produced as a restoration). Provide a date or a period of time via has_date and specify located_in as appropriate, e.g. the country where the principal offices or production facilities of the production company are located. Involved parties in various roles can be linked via has_activity. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.4.3

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

PublicationEvent.description: Publication event of a manifestation or possibly the first known publication of a work. Always specify the type of event and if possible a date or a period of time via has_date. Specify located_in as appropriate, e.g. the country where the manifestation was published. Involved parties in various roles can be linked via has_activity. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.4.1

Subject.description: Subject descriptor terms for the content of a film specifying its period, themes, locations, etc. Not to be confused with Genre. Provide name and if at all possible identifier(s) from supported authorities in the same_as slot. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.4.3 and FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms D.2.3

has_alternate_name.description: Alternative human-readable name(s) for a thing. Whereas has_name provides the preferred display name for the described entity, alternatives can be recorded here in order to be indexed in search engines, for instance

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing

WikidataResource.title: WikidataResource

WorkFormEnum.description: FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms D.1.9
WorkFormEnum.title: WorkFormEnum

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

described_by.description: Also record some metadata about the PID itself rather than the identified object

has_alternative_title.description: Additional title(s) associated with the work / variant, manifestation, or item.

has_event.description: Associate event(s) with a moving image record

has_form.description: Form describes the format and/or purpose of a Work, e.g., “non-fiction”, “short” and “animation”. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.4.3 and FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms D.1

has_genre.description: Genre describes categories of Works, characterized by similar plots, themes, settings, situations, and characters. Examples of genres are “westerns” and “thrillers”. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.4.3 and FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms D.2.1

has_identifier.description: Record PID in this slot when exporting data from the PID system. Use local identifiers instead when PIDs have not been registered yet. The latter is suitable for transferring data to the agent responsible for registering PIDs

has_primary_title.description: Primary title to be displayed in search results etc. The type should be PreferredTitle for works / variants and TitleProper for manifestations / items. If not available, type must be SuppliedDevisedTitle, instead.

has_subject.description: Subject descriptor terms for the content of a film specifying its period, themes, locations, etc. Not to be confused with Genre. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.4.3 and FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms D.2.3

is_part_of.description: Relate, for instance, episodes to a series / serial. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.17

is_variant_of.description: Link to the reference WorkVariant for the currently described variant. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.0.2, 1.1.2, 1.4.5

type.description: See specific class documentation for controlled vocabulary applicable to the type slot, respectively

variant_type.description: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual D.2

WorkVariantTypeEnum.description: Work/Variant description type. See also: FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual 1.2.1, D.1
WorkVariantTypeEnum.title: WorkVariantTypeEnum

WritingActivity.description: Activity types / roles. See also: FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms B.4

category.description: Designates type, e.g. to distinguish different identifiers (GNDResource vs. VIAFResource)

has_agent.description: Agent involved in some activity related to the moving image resource

type.description: See specific class documentation for controlled vocabulary applicable to the type slot, respectively

WritingActivity.title: WritingActivity

WritingActivityTypeEnum.description: Activity types / roles. See also: FIAF Glossary of Filmographic Terms B.4
WritingActivityTypeEnum.title: WritingActivityTypeEnum

has_record.description: Root slot holding the moving image metadata record, i.e. metadata describing a work/variant, manifestation or item. See also the Introduction of the FIAF Moving Image Cataloguing Manual
